main event: A radar object was observed over Herkimer, New York on September 22, 1963.
interesting points: The object was described as 'round', 'pea'-sized, and flashing red-green lights.
The object was observed for about 30 minutes at an altitude of 2 inches above the horizon, north of Herkimer.
The observation was made by ground-based radar and binoculars.
Similar aerial activity was observed in the same area from 7:25 PM to 8:30 PM on September 22nd, with parallel curves and undulating tracks.
The phenomenon was intense enough to be observed as far away as Rochester and Utica, New York.
sighted object: A round, pea-sized object with flashing red-green lights
witnesses: Radar operators and ground observers using binoculars
